gotchas.issue: After simplifying sidebar, main content area was blank - no Hello World or any view showing
gotchas.solution: Added navigationController.init() call in SPAInitializer.js line 73 - the NavigationController was being constructed but init() method was never called, so no initial navigation/view load occurred

gotchas.issue: Console showed 'NavigationController current view: dashboard' but no content rendered
gotchas.solution: The init() method sets up event listeners AND calls navigateTo(currentRoute) which actually loads the view - without init() call, just constructing the object does nothing

lesson: When refactoring complex systems, verify the ENTIRE initialization chain - object construction alone doesn't mean initialization. The NavigationController followed a two-step pattern: constructor() sets defaults, init() performs actual setup and initial navigation. Missing init() call is a common gotcha after refactoring.

architecture_decisions.init_method_pattern: NavigationController follows two-step initialization (constructor + init) - constructor sets defaults, init performs setup. This is common pattern for components that need DOM access.
